XMLTagHandler.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   XMLTagHandler.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008   Vaughan Johnson
00009 
00010   The XMLTagHandler class is an interface which should be implemented by
00011   classes which wish to be able to load and save themselves
00012   using XML files.
00013 
00014   The XMLValueChecker class implements static bool methods for checking 
00015   input values from XML files.
00016 
00017 **********************************************************************/
00018 #ifndef __AUDACITY_XML_TAG_HANDLER__
00019 #define __AUDACITY_XML_TAG_HANDLER__
00020 
00021 #include "../Audacity.h"
00022 #include <wx/string.h>
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 
00025 #include "XMLWriter.h"
00026 class XMLValueChecker
00027 {
00028 public:
00029    // "Good" means well-formed and for the file-related functions, names an existing file or folder.
00030    // These are used in HandleXMLTag and BuildFomXML methods to check the input for 
00031    // security vulnerabilites, per the NGS report for UmixIt.
00032    static bool IsGoodString(const wxString str);
00033 
00034    static bool IsGoodFileName(const wxString strFileName, const wxString strDirName = wxEmptyString);
00035    static bool IsGoodSubdirName(const wxString strSubdirName, const wxString strDirName = wxEmptyString);
00036    static bool IsGoodPathName(const wxString strPathName);
00037 
00038    // Note that because wxString::ToLong does additional testing, IsGoodInt doesn't duplicate 
00039    // that testing, so use wxString::ToLong after IsGoodInt, not just atoi.
00040    static bool IsGoodInt(const wxString strInt);
00041 
00042    static bool IsValidChannel(const int nValue); 
00043    static bool IsValidSampleFormat(const int nValue); // true if nValue is one sampleFormat enum values
00044 
00045    static bool IsGoodFileString(wxString str);
00046 };
00047 
00048 
00049 class AUDACITY_DLL_API XMLTagHandler {
00050  public:
00051    XMLTagHandler(){};
00052    virtual ~XMLTagHandler(){};
00053    //
00054    // Methods to override
00055    //
00056 
00057    // This method will be called on your class if your class has
00058    // been registered to handle this particular tag.  Parse the
00059    // tag and the attribute-value pairs (null-terminated), and
00060    // return true on success, and false on failure.  If you return
00061    // false, you will not get any calls about children.
00062    virtual bool HandleXMLTag(const wxChar *tag, const wxChar **attrs) = 0;
00063 
00064    // This method will be called when a closing tag is encountered.
00065    // It is optional to override this method.
00066    virtual void HandleXMLEndTag(const wxChar *tag) {}
00067 
00068    // This method will be called when element content has been
00069    // encountered.
00070    // It is optional to override this method.
00071    virtual void HandleXMLContent(const wxString & content) {}
00072 
00073    // If the XML document has children of your tag, this method
00074    // should be called.  Typically you should construct a new
00075    // object for the child, insert it into your own local data
00076    // structures, and then return it.  If you do not wish to
00077    // handle this child, return NULL and it will be ignored.
00078    virtual XMLTagHandler *HandleXMLChild(const wxChar *tag) = 0;
00079 
00080    // These functions recieve data from expat.  They do charset
00081    // conversion and then pass the data to the handlers above.
00082    bool ReadXMLTag(const char *tag, const char **attrs);
00083    void ReadXMLEndTag(const char *tag);
00084    void ReadXMLContent(const char *s, int len);
00085    XMLTagHandler *ReadXMLChild(const char *tag);
00086 };
00087 
00088 #endif // define __AUDACITY_XML_TAG_HANDLER__
